attributes.name: Suspicious Print Spooler Point and Print DLL v100.0.2
attributes.description: Detects attempts to exploit a privilege escalation vulnerability (CVE-2020-1030) related to the print spooler service. Exploitation involves chaining multiple primitives to load an arbitrary DLL into the print spooler process running as SYSTEM.
author: Elastic
attributes.query:
sequence by host.id with maxspan=30s
[registry where
 registry.path : "HKLM\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\Windows NT\\CurrentVersion\\Print\\Printers\\*\\SpoolDirectory" and
 registry.data.strings : "C:\\Windows\\System32\\spool\\drivers\\x64\\4"]
[registry where
 registry.path : "HKLM\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\Windows NT\\CurrentVersion\\Print\\Printers\\*\\CopyFiles\\Payload\\Module" and
 registry.data.strings : "C:\\Windows\\System32\\spool\\drivers\\x64\\4\\*"]
